RadiusMsg.h

00001 // RadiusMsg.h
00002 //
00003 /// \mainpage RADIUS Library for Arduino
00004 ///
00005 /// This library provides services for creating and sending RADIUS requests and receiving and 
00006 /// decoding RADIUS replies. It also provides a class for managing a UDP Socket, 
00007 /// over which RADIUS requests are sent and received.
00008 ///
00009 /// It is designed to be used with the Arduino Ethernet shield and ArduinoMega. 
00010 /// The size of the binary is such that a complete RADIUS client is too big for an 
00011 /// Arduino Diecimila (which the 
00012 /// Ethernet shield is designed for), and you need an ArduinoMega or similar.
00013 /// Unfortunately, you need to make some special hardware arrangements to make the 
00014 /// Ethernet shield work with Arduino Mega, although no soldering is required:  
00015 /// see http://mcukits.com/2009/04/06/arduino-ethernet-shield-mega-hack/ 
00016 /// and http://www.arduino.cc/cgi-bin/yabb2/YaBB.pl?num=1252386632
00017 /// Note that 3 pins on the Ethernet shield must be bent out of the way to make this work.
00018 ///
00019 /// The latest version of this documentation  can be downloaded from
00020 /// http://www.open.com.au/mikem/arduino/Radius
00021 ///
00022 /// The version of the package that this documentation refers to can be downloaded
00023 /// from http://www.open.com.au/mikem/arduino/Radius/Radius-1.1.zip
00024 ///
00025 /// The package includes a sample RadiusClient sketch, which gives a working example of 
00026 /// how to use the library.
00027 ///
00028 /// \par Open Source Licensing GPL V2
00029 /// This is the appropriate option if you want to share the source code of your
00030 /// application with everyone you distribute it to, and you also want to give them
00031 /// the right to share who uses it. If you wish to use this software under Open
00032 /// Source Licensing, you must contribute all your source code to the open source
00033 /// community in accordance with the GPL Version 2 when your application is
00034 /// distributed. See http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html
00035 ///
00036 /// \par Commercial Licensing
00037 /// This is the appropriate option if you are creating proprietary applications
00038 /// and you are not prepared to distribute and share the source code of your
00039 /// application. Contact info@open.com.au for details.
00040 ///
00041 /// \par Revision History
00042 /// \version 1.0 Initial release
00043 /// \version 1.1 Builds on Arduino 1.0
00044 ///
00045 /// \author  Mike McCauley (mikem@open.com.au)
00046 // Copyright (C) 2009 Mike McCauley
00047 // $Id: RadiusMsg.h,v 1.1 2009/10/13 05:07:28 mikem Exp mikem $
00048 
00049 #ifndef _RADIUSMSG_H_
00050 #define _RADIUSMSG_H_
00051 
00052 #include "UDPSocket.h"
00053 
00054 #define RADIUS_AUTHENTICATOR_LENGTH 16
00055 #define RADIUS_PASSWORD_BLOCK_SIZE 16
00056 #define RADIUS_HEADER_LENGTH 20
00057 // In actuality, the max permitted RADIUS packet size is 4096, but arduino cant handle that size
00058 // so we artificially limit packets to 1000 octets
00059 #define RADIUS_MAX_SIZE 1000
00060 #define RADIUS_MAX_ATTRIBUTE_SIZE 253
00061 typedef uint8_t RadiusAuthenticator[RADIUS_AUTHENTICATOR_LENGTH];
00062 
00063 // RADIUS message type
00064 typedef enum
00065 {
00066     RadiusCodeAccessRequest                        = 1,
00067     RadiusCodeAccessAccept                         = 2,
00068     RadiusCodeAccessReject                         = 3,
00069     RadiusCodeAccountingRequest                    = 4,
00070     RadiusCodeAccountingResponse                   = 5,
00071     RadiusCodeAccountingStatus                     = 6,
00072     RadiusCodeAccessPasswordRequest                = 7,
00073     RadiusCodeAccessPasswordAck                    = 8,
00074     RadiusCodeAccessPasswordReject                 = 9,
00075     RadiusCodeAccountingMessage                    = 10,
00076     RadiusCodeAccessChallenge                      = 11,
00077     RadiusCodeStatusServer                         = 12,
00078     RadiusCodeStatusClient                         = 13,
00079     RadiusCodeResourceFreeRequest                  = 21,
00080     RadiusCodeResourceFreeResponse                 = 22,
00081     RadiusCodeResourceQueryRequest                 = 23,
00082     RadiusCodeResourceQueryResponse                = 24,
00083     RadiusCodeAlternateResourceReclaimRequest      = 25,
00084     RadiusCodeNASRebootRequest                     = 26,
00085     RadiusCodeNASRebootResponse                    = 27,
00086     RadiusCodeAscendAccessNextCode                 = 29,
00087     RadiusCodeAscendAccessNewPin                   = 30,
00088     RadiusCodeAscendTerminateSession               = 31,
00089     RadiusCodeAscendPasswordExpired                = 32,
00090     RadiusCodeAscendAccessEventRequest             = 33,
00091     RadiusCodeAscendAccessEventResponse            = 34,
00092     RadiusCodeDisconnectRequest                    = 40,
00093     RadiusCodeDisconnectRequestACKed               = 41,
00094     RadiusCodeDisconnectRequestNAKed               = 42,
00095     RadiusCodeChangeFilterRequest                  = 43,
00096     RadiusCodeChangeFilterRequestACKed             = 44,
00097     RadiusCodeChangeFilterRequestNAKed             = 45,
00098     RadiusCodeIPAddressAllocate                    = 50,
00099     RadiusCodeIPAddressRelease                     = 51,
00100     // This is the next code after the last valid one
00101     RadiusCodeStartInvalidCodes                    = 52
00102 }   RadiusCode;

00245 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00246 /// \struct RadiusPacket
00247 /// Helper class for mapping RADIUS request packets, including the header
00248 /// See RFC 2138
00249 typedef struct
00250 {
00251     /// The RADIUS message type code
00252     uint8_t  code;
00253 
00254     /// RADIUS identifier
00255     uint8_t  identifier;
00256 
00257     /// Total length of the packet, including the header
00258     uint16_t length;
00259 
00260     /// RADISU authenticator
00261     uint8_t  authenticator[RADIUS_AUTHENTICATOR_LENGTH];
00262 
00263     /// All attributes in serial packed format
00264     uint8_t  attrs[RADIUS_MAX_SIZE - RADIUS_HEADER_LENGTH];
00265 
00266 } RadiusPacket;
00267 
00268 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00269 /// \struct RadiusAttrHeader
00270 /// Maps a RADIUS Attribute, including the header
00271 typedef struct
00272 {
00273     /// Attribute number
00274     uint8_t  type;
00275 
00276     /// Total length, including header
00277     uint8_t  length;
00278 
00279     /// Value of the attribute. May have some internal structure, such as for VSAs etc
00280     uint8_t  value[RADIUS_MAX_ATTRIBUTE_SIZE];
00281 
00282 } RadiusAttrHeader;
00283 
00284 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00285 /// \class RadiusMsg RadiusMsg.h <RadiusMsg.h>
00286 /// \brief Class to create, format and send RADIUS requests and replies
00287 ///
00288 /// This class is used in conjunction with UDPSocket to create, format and send RADIUS requests, 
00289 /// and to receive, authenticate and decode RADIUS replies. Works with the Arduino Ethernet shield
00290 /// to connect to a LAN and communicate with a RDAIUS server, such as Radiator RADIUS Server 
00291 /// (http://www.open.com.au/radiator)
00292 ///
00293 /// Conforms broadly to RFC 2138 and 2139, with limitations:
00294 /// \li Vendor Specific Attribautes are not supported
00295 /// \li The only encrypted attribtute supported is User-Password
00296 ///
00297 /// There is no RADIUS dictionary: When adding attributes to a reque or getting attriburtes 
00298 /// from a reply, you are required to use the appropriate calls according to the attribute 
00299 /// type of the attribute you are using: binary, string or integer
00300 class RadiusMsg
00301 {
00302 private:
00303     /// The formatted RADIUS packet, including header
00304     RadiusPacket packet;
00305 
00306     /// The number of valid bytes in the packet, including the header, Min 20
00307     uint16_t     packetLength;
00308 
00309     /// Number of retries for retransmission
00310     uint8_t      retries;
00311 
00312     ///  retransmission timeout in seconds
00313     uint8_t      timeout;
00314 
00315     /// The IP address of the peer destination address (when sent) or the sender address when received
00316     IP4Address   peerAddress;
00317 
00318     /// The port number of the peer
00319     uint16_t     peerPort;
00320 
00321 public:
00322     /// Constructor for receiving
00323     RadiusMsg();
00324 
00325     /// Constructor for sending. RADIUS message type code is initialised
00326     RadiusMsg(RadiusCode code);
00327   
00328     /// Return the RADIUS message type code
00329     /// \return RADIUS message type code
00330     uint8_t  code();
00331 
00332     /// Add an attribute to the request, binary octets
00333     /// \param[in] type The RADIUS attribute number
00334     /// \param[in] vendor The vendor number of the attribue (unused, set to 0)
00335     /// \param[in] value Pointer to the octets of the value
00336     /// \param[in] length Number of octets in the value
00337     void     addAttr(unsigned type, unsigned vendor, uint8_t* value, uint8_t length);
00338 
00339     /// Add a CString type attribute to the request
00340     /// \param[in] type The RADIUS attribute number
00341     /// \param[in] vendor The vendor number of the attribue (unused, set to 0)
00342     /// \param[in] value CString value to set. String up to (but not including) the first NUL 
00343     /// are used to set th value
00344     void     addAttr(unsigned type, unsigned vendor, const char* value);
00345 
00346     /// Add a 32 bit unsigned integer type to the request
00347     /// \param[in] type The RADIUS attribute number
00348     /// \param[in] vendor The vendor number of the attribue (unused, set to 0)
00349     /// \param[in] value 32 bit unsigned integer value
00350     void     addAttr(unsigned type, unsigned vendor, uint32_t value);
00351 
00352     /// Get the nth attribute with matching attribute number (and optional vendor number)
00353     /// Skips over 'skip' attributes to get the 'skip'th matching attribute
00354     /// \param[in] type The RADIUS attribute number
00355     /// \param[in] vendor The vendor number of the attribue (unused, set to 0)
00356     /// \param[in] value Destination to copy the value to
00357     /// \param[in] length Caller sets this to the maximum permitted length available in value. 
00358     /// if return is 1, up to length octets will be copied, and *length will be set to the actual 
00359     /// number of octets copied.
00360     /// \param[in] skip Number of matching attributes to skip (defaults to 0,
00361     /// which means get the first matching one)
00362     /// \return true if a match was found and the value copied
00363     uint8_t  getAttr(unsigned type, unsigned vendor, uint8_t* value, uint8_t* length, uint8_t skip = 0);
00364 
00365     /// Get the nth attribute with matching attribue number (and optional vendor number) 
00366     /// as a 32 bit unsigned integer
00367     /// \param[in] type The RADIUS attribute number
00368     /// \param[in] vendor The vendor number of the attribue (unused, set to 0)
00369     /// \param[in] value Destination to copy the value to
00370     /// \param[in] skip Number of matching attributes to skip (defaults to 0,
00371     /// which means get the first matching one)
00372     /// \return true if a match was found and the value copied
00373     uint8_t  getAttr(unsigned type, unsigned vendor, uint32_t* value, uint8_t skip = 0);
00374 
00375     /// Encrypts any parameters that require encryption, and sets the authethenticator
00376     /// for RADIUS codes that require it. Uses the shared secret for encryption and signing.
00377     /// \param[in] secret The RADIUS shared secret
00378     /// \param[in] secretLength Length of the secret in octets
00379     /// \param[in] original for RADIUS requests that are replies to an earlier request, this 
00380     /// points to the original requerst, which is required to correctly set the authenticator in the reply.
00381     void     sign(uint8_t* secret, uint8_t secretLength, RadiusMsg* original = 0);
00382 
00383     /// Sends this RADIUS message on a UDP Socket
00384     /// \param[in] socket Instance of UDPSocket to use to send the message
00385     /// \param[in] peer IPV4Address of the destination RADIUS peer
00386     /// \param[in] port Port number of the destination RADIUS peer
00387     /// \return Returns the sent packet size for success, else -1
00388     uint16_t sendto(UDPSocket* socket, IP4Address peer, uint16_t port);
00389 
00390     /// Utility function for encryption passwords and other data in RADIUS RFC compliant fashion
00391     /// \param[in] data The data octets to encrypt
00392     /// \param[in] length Number of octets in data
00393     /// \param[in] secret The RADIUS shared secret
00394     /// \param[in] secretLength Length of the secret in octets
00395     /// \param[in] iv The intialisation vector
00396     void     encryptPassword(uint8_t* data, uint8_t length, uint8_t* secret, uint8_t secretLength, uint8_t* iv);
00397 
00398     /// Fill the packet data in the RadiusMsg with the next packet received on socket.
00399     /// Blocks until a packet is received. Packets that are received and which dont look
00400     /// vaguely like a RADIUS essage are discarded
00401     /// \param socket Pointer to the UDP socket to receive from
00402     /// \return The number of octets in the received message else 0 if the message was discarded
00403     uint16_t recv(UDPSocket* socket);
00404 
00405     /// Send a message to the destiantion server, and wait for a matching reply. 
00406     /// Implements timeouts and retries until a matching reply is received
00407     /// Non-matching RADIUS requests are silently discarded.
00408     /// Blocks until a satisfying reply is received or all retries are exhausted
00409     /// \param[in] socket Pointer to the UDP socket used to send and receive
00410     /// \param[in] server IP4Address of the destination server
00411     /// \param[in] port The port number of the RADIUS server at the destination
00412     /// \param[in] reply Pointer to a RadiusMsg which will be filled in with the reply (if any)
00413     /// \return true if the request was snetr and a matchin reply received
00414     uint8_t  sendWaitReply(UDPSocket* socket, IP4Address server, uint16_t port, RadiusMsg* reply);
00415 
00416     /// Checks that the authenticator in the RadiusMsg is correct, and that therefore is 
00417     /// verified as being from the expected peer. For RADIUS replies, requires the 
00418     /// original request to be supplied.
00419     /// \param[in] secret The RADIUS shared secret
00420     /// \param[in] secretLength Length of the secret in octets
00421     /// \param[in] original When checking the authenticator of a RADIUS reply, this must point to the
00422     /// original request
00423     /// \return true if authenticator is correct.
00424     uint8_t  checkAuthenticatorsWithOriginal(uint8_t* secret, uint8_t secretLength, RadiusMsg* original);
00425 };
00426 
00427 
00428 #endif
Generated on Thu Jan 5 07:50:20 2012 for Radius by  1.5.6
